name: Cooper Station
description: A massive cylindrical space station orbiting Saturn, designed to simulate Earth's gravitational and living conditions.

content.title: History
content.body: Cooper Station was named after Joseph Cooper, the protagonist of 'Interstellar,' as a tribute to his contributions in finding a new home for humanity. It represents a new beginning for the human race after Earth was rendered inhospitable. This space station marked a significant achievement in humanity's struggle to survive beyond Earth.

content.title: Geography
content.body: Cooper Station is a massive cylindrical space station situated in orbit around Saturn. It is structured to replicate Earth-like living conditions, complete with land, water, and an artificially created sky.

content.title: Notable Features
content.body: The station is notable for its rotating cylindrical design, which creates artificial gravity through centripetal force. Interior sections resemble terrestrial environments, including farmlands and small towns. The station offers a visually seamless blend of natural and technological elements, enhancing its livability.

content.title: Story Significance
content.body: In 'Interstellar,' Cooper Station symbolizes hope and survival for humanity. It is where Cooper reunites with his daughter, Murph, as an old woman, marking a personal closure to his journey. The station also represents the successful outcome of the missions initiated by Professor Brand and NASA to find a sustainable habitat for humans.
